issue.title: mail.ru

labels.name: Extra
labels.description: Issues, related to AdGuard Extra extension

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
This issue has been escalated to [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra):
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra/issues/375

Please wait until it is solved there.

If youre using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, youre probably already using AdGuard Extra so you just need to wait until it is updated.

If youre using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

issue.title: Dakar Desert Rally (Windows app; the report form didn't accept "Dakar2Game.exe" as a URL)
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard DNS

### AdGuard version

Unclear; we can assume the `2022-11-14T00:03:01.988Z` list version

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

the problem is with app, not a site

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

"Dakar Desert Rally" on Steam/EGS, most visibly at the startlines of stages.

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard DNS filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. I received an interesting heads-up from [an owner of *Dakar Desert Rally* on PCGamingWiki](https://www.pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Topic:X6von2hsqay3oswt), who claimed to have encountered ads in hub areas and startlines, but who allegedly found a way to block them. The supposed info was interesting enough that I'm forwarding it near-verbatim without actually having tested it myself.

The entries they suggested were:
```
||anzusafeframe.azureedge.net^
||assets.anzuinfra.com^
||caps-server.anzu.io^
||emqx.anzuinfra.com^
||events.anzuinfra.com^
||l1-1.anzu.io^
||logic.anzuinfra.com^
||mgw-2.anzuinfra.com^
```

Other than this, the provided details were somewhat sparse, including if they used any other entries/filters for anything.

3. Screenshots

They had not posted any screenshots at the time of writing.


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition
